poem:
Title: "Morning Musings on Market Movements"

Red dawn breaks, good tidings for sterling,
Whispers of power, the pound yearns earning.
Euro's blush fades, elections turn tide,
Muddy the waters in the divide.

JP speaks; Labour's reign foretold,
Prosperity for banks, the young, the old.
Centrist dance, growth's gentle song,
Universe of market where we belong.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labour victory ‘would be good news for the pound’; euro weakens after European elections – business live 9.59am BST JP Morgan: Labour win good for banks, homebuilders and food retail Analysts at JP Morgan say a Labour win in the UK general election would be a positive development for the financial markets. In an Equity Strategy note published this morning, they explain that Labour is “occupying a centrist platform”, saying: Labour agenda is modestly pro-growth,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Labour victory ‘would be good news for the pound’; euro weakens after European elections – business live 9.59am BST JP Morgan: Labour win good for banks, homebuilders and food retail Analysts at JP Morgan say a Labour win in the UK general election would be a positive development for the financial markets. In an Equity Strategy note published this morning, they explain that Labour is “occupying a centrist platform”, saying: Labour agenda is modestly pro-growth,
